page.description: Returns the present value of a stream of periodic investments over a specified integer term.
page.syntax: Present_Value as N = PV(N periodic_investment,N periodic_interest_rate,N time_periods)

argument.name: periodic_investment
argument.description: The amount of each equal investment, which may be either positive or negative. Numeric

argument.name: periodic_interest_rate
argument.description: Interest rate per time period. Interest rate must be a positive number. Numeric

argument.name: time_periods
argument.description: Number of time periods (and investments), which must be a positive number. Numeric

page.discussion: PV() returns the present value of a stream of Investment s, invested at a fixed Interest_Rate for a certain Number_Of_Time_Periods. The PV() function is used to find the amount that must be invested now to produce a given future amount.
